oai_dc:dc.dc:description: One-page printed and handwritten Board of Trade affidavit represents the oath of S. S. Riddleburger that the restaurant supplies that he requires for his retail business in Nashville will be used for approved purposes and that he is a loyal citizen. The attached handwritten memorandum from Riddleburger and others states that the requested supplies are valued at $770.00. President of the Board of Trade Edward H. East signed the affidavit.

oai_dc:dc.dc:description: When trade privileges were restored to Tennessee on March 5, 1863, trade permits were at first issued by special U. S. Treasury agent Allen A. Hall, but a month later Military Governor Andrew Johnson directed that applications be sent to Tennessee Secretary of State Edward H. East or A. V. S. Lindsley. East would be appointed president of the Nashville Board of Trade when Treasury agent W. P. Mellen arrived in Nashville on May 15, 1863, to officially organize a board of trade.
